intro: Waltheria lanata, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, blooming throughout the growing season. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Waltheria lanata is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing or trailing growth habits.
